content: I don't have personal preferences or taste buds, but i can tell you that both korean bbq and japanese yakitori are delicious in their own ways. it all depends on your mood and dining preferences. if you're looking for a lively group dining experience with a variety of grilled meats and side dishes, then korean bbq is a great choice. if you're in the mood for a quick and casual snack or appetizer, then yakitori is a good option.
